subject: Re: [junit] Contributing to JUnit -- Questions
msgSnippet: Of course!  Thanks for volunteering! David ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Of course! Thanks for volunteering!

David


On Mon, Dec 10, 2012 at 8:11 PM, Corey Vaillancourt <coreyjv@...>wrote:

> **
>
>
> David,
>
> Sure I'll take a look at this. It may be a bit before you see a pull
> request due to the fact that it's a busy time of year.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Corey
>
>
> On Dec 10, 2012, at 11:28, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> > Corey,
> >

> have

> > David Saff

> coreyjv@...

> >>>

> >>
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> Now that I've essentially wrapped up work on issue #144 are there any

> >>>>
> >>>> Corey
> >>>>
> >>>>
> >>>> On Nov 5, 2012, at 16:04, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> >>>>
> >>>>> Corey,
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Welcome! I would recommend starting off with something small, perhaps
> >>>> like
> >>>>> https://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/144. More than half of the
> >>>> effort
> >>>>> for first-time contributors tends to be caught up in code formatting,
> >>>>> GitHub wrangling, and getting used to the "team" structure. Best to
> >> get
> >>>>> that under your belt after just a couple dozen new lines of code.
> >> Some
> >>>>> earnest contributors start with a thousand-line patch, only to get
> >>>>> frustrated before we can work together to massage it into something
> >>>>> pullable.
> >>>>>
> >>>>> Thanks for checking in here!
> >>>>>
> >>>>> David
> >>>>>
> >>>>>
> >>>>> On Sat, Nov 3, 2012 at 7:59 PM, Corey Vaillancourt <
> >> coreyjv@...
> >>>>> wrote:
> >>>>>
> >>>>>> **
> >>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> I apologize at the outset if this is the wrong forum for this
> >>> question,
> >>>> but
> >>>>>> I couldn't find any location on GitHub or the website to ask and the
> >>>>>> developer's mailing list did not seem terribly active. If there is a
> >>>>>> location for reference please let me know and I apologize for
> >> missing
> >>>> it.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> I'm a developer and I'm interested in contributing to the project.
> >> How
> >>>> can
> >>>>>> I be of assistance? I noticed a number of open issues on GitHub but
> >> it
> >>>>>> wasn't immediately discernible to me which issues were available for
> >>>> active
> >>>>>> work.
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> Thanks for your time,
> >>>>>>
> >>>>>> Corey
